at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.migration

Interface IMigrationEnabledJCloudScaleHost

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IJCloudScaleServer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MigrationEnabledJCloudScaleServer, MigrationEnabledVirtualHostProxy

    public interface IMigrationEnabledJCloudScaleHost
extends IJCloudScaleServer
    Add migration-specific methods to IJCloudScaleServer

    IJCloudScaleServerMigration is JCloudScaleServer-side

    See Also:
    IVirtualHostMigration

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deployMigratedCloudObject(String objectId, String classname, byte[] serializedCloudObject)
      Deploys a previously serialized cloud object.

      • Methods inherited from interface at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.IJCloudScaleServer

        createNewCloudObject, destroyCloudObject, getCloudObjectField, getCloudObjectType, keepAliveCloudObject, resumeInvocation, setCloudObjectField, shutdown, startInvokingCloudObject, suspendInvocation

    • Method Detail

      • serializeToMigrate

        byte[] serializeToMigrate(String objectId)
        Prepares a cloud object for migration. After successful preparation the cloud object is serialized and returned to the caller as byte array.
        Parameters:
        objectId - The cloud object to prepare/migrate
        Returns:
        The serialized cloud object as byte array

      • deployMigratedCloudObject

        void deployMigratedCloudObject(String objectId,
                             String classname,
                             byte[] serializedCloudObject)
        Deploys a previously serialized cloud object. Deployment includes deserialization, initialization, preparation and registration of the cloud object's id at the cloud host
        Parameters:
        objectId - The id of the cloud object
        classname - Classname of the serialized cloud object
        serializedCloudObject - The serialized cloud object

      • removeCloudObject

        void removeCloudObject(String id)
        Destroys the remaining cloud object on the source host after a successful migration. This method is basically only a wrapper for IJCloudScaleServer.destroyCloudObject(String) to prevent ObjectLifecycleEventAspect from issuing a ObjectDestroyedEvent.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the migrated cloud object
